tag_to_content.title: Claret Capital Partners – We Provide Growth Capital to Innovative Businesses
tag_to_content.h1_0: We Provide Growth Capital to Innovative Businesses
tag_to_content.p_0: Since 2013 we’ve backed over 170 European SMEs from a wide range of geographies across Europe. The Claret team have been active in the technology financing markets for over 20 years.
tag_to_content.p_1: Razor Group is a new-age global consumer holding based in Berlin, Germany. They partner with Amazon FBA merchants to acquire and scale highly profitable brands across categories, distribution channels and geographies.
tag_to_content.p_2: SuperAwesome is making the internet safer for kids. The company’s kidtech platform enables safe, compliant digital engagement with kids and young teens around the world. SuperAwesome is used by hundreds of brands and thousands of developers to enable over 12.5B kid-safe transactions every month. Founded in 2013, the company was acquired by Epic Games in 2020.
tag_to_content.p_3: PPRO is the industry’s trusted provider of local payments infrastructure, powering global growth for payment companies. Companies at the forefront of payment technology leverage PPRO’s unified platform, expert services, and local payment methods to boost sales in over 100 e-commerce markets worldwide.
tag_to_content.p_4: Butternut Box is a UK-based startup, founded by two friends, Kev & Dave. The two started the company so that they could deliver health and happiness to dogs and their humans all over the world. They’re serving up a fresh take on dog food.
tag_to_content.p_5: Jobandtalent is the world’s leading workforce marketplace. Their on-demand staffing marketplace aims to make the labour market more fluid and accessible by tearing down the barriers to job searching and hiring.
tag_to_content.p_6: Novacyt develops and sells diagnostic products for cancer and infectious diseases. The company also develops, manufactures, and distributes diagnostic products for clinical and food laboratories; and manufactures and markets vitro diagnostic tests, as well as diagnostic reagents, test kits, and blood grouping reagents.
tag_to_content.p_7: Claret Capital Partners Limited (company registered number 12516001) is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FRN 993228).

tag_to_content.title: About - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_0: The principals of Claret Capital Partners have been providing growth financing to innovative businesses for more than 20 years, during which time they have backed more than 200 companies.
tag_to_content.p_1: Based in London, England, Claret Capital Partners (Formerly Harbert European Growth Capital) is a Leader in European Growth Lending and a proud member of Invest Europe.
tag_to_content.p_2: Claret’s mission is to provide Technology and Life Science businesses with the Growth Capital that they need to succeed, while providing a less dilutive alternative to traditional equity fundraising. The Claret team have a significant track record of partnering with a large number of growth businesses over the last 20 years and are committed to continuing to be a trusted, market leader in the European eco-system.
tag_to_content.p_3: We fund high growth business with proven management teams in need of less dilutive capital to drive their continued ambitions.
tag_to_content.p_4: Our capital can be used to fund:
tag_to_content.li_17: Bridge loans extending cash runway to the next capital round
tag_to_content.li_18: And can support various forms of recapitalization
tag_to_content.p_5: Our loans vary in size but are typically between €1 million to €50 million, with each business evaluated on an independent basis by our team of experienced investment professionals.
tag_to_content.p_6: We play a supporting role and our investment is a signal we trust yours and the board’s decision making and focus on the quality of interactions rather than quantity. We can also contribute to supporting you with our extensive network in the technology investment ecosystem.
tag_to_content.p_7: Claret Capital Partners provides financing to growth-stage European companies with strong management and proven revenue traction in substantial markets. We fund cash burning and negative EBITDA companies and profitability is not a requirement.
tag_to_content.li_19: Senior loans secured on business assets only
tag_to_content.li_20: Our loans typically have a maturity of 3-5 years and are usually amortising. These can also be tranched to fit your cash flow requirements
tag_to_content.li_21: We include an equity participation to enable us to participate in your future success
tag_to_content.p_9: Claret are a team who focus on the underlying potential of the businesses they work with and really listen to management to understand the drivers of success. Having them on board was a very rewarding and successful experience for Novacyt.
tag_to_content.p_10: Claret has been an exceptional partner since Day 1. Beyond simply providing debt capital, the team has invested significant amounts of time in advising us on strategic matters of all sorts. They are able to think across the capital structure and have helped to create shareholder value by developing creative, flexible financing solutions together with us.
tag_to_content.div_5: Tushar Ahluwalia, CEO and Christoph Gamon, CCO
tag_to_content.p_11: We evaluated a range of venture debt funds and found the best chemistry and understanding with Claret. They’re practical, growth oriented and incredibly responsive. I’d definitely work with them again.
tag_to_content.p_12: Butternut is driven by our founding purpose of delivering health and happiness to dogs and their humans all over the world. With the help of Claret Capital we have been able to accelerate our purpose through additional investment in manufacturing and marketing in order to to expand our base of customers who love feeding their dogs fresh food. They have been an incredible partner every step of the way.

tag_to_content.title: What is the real cost of capital in Venture Debt? - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_0: By Lyall Davenport, Principal, Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_1: Following my previous piece on using venture debt , and my promise (to myself more than anyone else) to follow-up with monthly thought pieces, I have been working on a history of venture debt piece (watch this space). However, as I settle into my second coffee in an attempt to clear the inbox before a flight, I come across a Sifted Daily Newsletter from a few weeks ago and their lead piece on the Silence of the Rounds. Whilst I largely agree with the sentiment of the piece – VC’s have been quiet for the last 12 months, non-traditional sources of capital are filling equity rounds and quiet internal rounds are in vogue right now – there is one comment that sticks which I want to address…
tag_to_content.p_2: “It could also mean that founders will look to cut costs rather than raise more money at a lower valuation […], it’s either that or look to venture debt – an expensive option given current business rates.”
tag_to_content.strong_0: it’s either that or look to venture debt – an expensive option given current business rates.
tag_to_content.p_4: …the idea that venture debt is more expensive now (which in my view is only half true), and that this is driven by the current interest rates. So, to restore the honor of the poor-slighted venture debt provider (not all heroes wear capes), I will dive into this, and look at “true” venture debt versus other lenders and equity to understand the real cost of venture debt to a start-up in the down round economy.
tag_to_content.p_6: For the purposes of this tome I will attempt to provide my brief definition of venture debt and a venture debt fund, versus other forms of lending. Whilst this is not exhaustive; I hope it will provide some light on the cost structure.
tag_to_content.p_7: Venture debt traditionally provides secured term loans, with no – or low – covenants whilst charging an interest rate (typically low double digits) and warrant coverage, giving them the right to buy shares in the future at a defined price. In Europe today this market is served by a handful of funds (Claret Capital Partners being one of the leading independent managers in the space), and somewhat replicated by banks who dip their toe into the space.
tag_to_content.p_8: There are also other debt providers that often get lumped within Venture Debt – these can be Revenue Based Lenders underwriting predictable revenue streams and charging a percentage of these streams, banks providing term loans but looking to drive other banking services through their platforms, or mid-market lenders that will charge similar interest rates but would introduce more restrictive covenants and typically wouldn’t have warrants as part of their deals.
tag_to_content.p_9: With that preamble in place, the point is that a borrower should know their lenders’ sources of capital to understand the cost of capital for their debt. Funds (which make up most true European venture debt providers under the above definition), and those lenders that raised fixed, blind pools of capital from LPs typically have a fixed cost of capital (the hurdle rate). Therefore the assertion that central bank interest rates make the cost of venture debt more expensive misses the mark. The opposite is true of other sources of debt, (banks, mid-market, RBF lenders etc.) where they are investing capital provided by a bank or other institution, and are charging a premium over central bank rates for riskier investments, as their cost of capital has increased in line with the rate hikes over the last 24 months – going forward I will call these Alternative Lenders.
tag_to_content.p_10: To put it simply, the return Alternative Lenders need to make to justify their access to capital has increased, and therefore so has the cost for the borrower. However, venture debt providers have maintained the same cost of capital throughout, despite the increase in interest rates.
tag_to_content.p_11: So, the cost of venture debt hasn’t changed?
tag_to_content.p_12: In absolute terms no. We have seen some increase in interest rates over the last 24 months – this is largely driven by the market and risk (as there is less equity in the market underwriting future equity rounds, and in many cases the repayment of loans has become riskier). It is also driven by Alternative Lenders having to come into the venture debt space to justify their cost of capital.
tag_to_content.p_13: However, these increases have been minor compared to the central bank rates. Today the Bank of England central rate is 5.15% higher than it was in 2021, whilst the cost of venture debt has only increased from 1%-2% from the lowest interest rates at the peak of the free money era in 2020-2021.
tag_to_content.p_14: What about warrants, I hear nay-sayers calling from the bleachers? Tune in next week as I explore warrant pricing in the current market.
tag_to_content.p_15: I look forward to extending the conversation – please reach out to me directly if you have questions, comments, or corrections!

tag_to_content.title: Sustainability Statement - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_0: At Claret Capital Partners Limited (“Claret”) we recognise the importance of sustainability risks and the potential impact these can have on our activities, specifically managing our firm, fund raising activities, and making & managing investments.
tag_to_content.p_1: A sustainability risk is defined as an environmental, social or governance event or condition that, if it occurs, could cause an actual or potential material negative impact on the value of the investment. As part of our Due Diligence process prior to an investment decision, Claret requests copies of the ESG policies and strategies of a potential portfolio company, and details of which ESG responsible officers, and what experience those employees have. Any material ESG issues will be presented to the investment committee as part of the approval process, and will contribute to any investment decision.
tag_to_content.p_2: As a lender we cannot significantly influence the ESG related policies of our portfolio companies. So whilst ESG is an input into our overall investment process, investment decisions will always be made on an assessment of the overall risk/return (not solely on ESG factors alone).
tag_to_content.p_3: Claret’s ESG policy includes exclusion criteria with respect to a potential portfolio company’s business activities that are not eligible for investment, as part of the investment process.
tag_to_content.p_4: Claret’s policies may evolve over time in line with relevant recommendations, guidelines and policies.
tag_to_content.p_5: Remuneration levels of employees are justified according to performance of the individual concerned, as reviewed on a regular basis. Whilst the policy does not fully integrate sustainability risks, performance evaluation of an employee may include consideration for ESG contribution.

tag_to_content.title: TIS signs binding agreement with Marlin Equity Partners to secure a majority growth investment - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_0: Treasury Intelligence Solutions (“TIS”), a global leader in cloud-native cash management, liquidity and payment solutions has announced that it has signed a binding agreement to secure majority growth investment from Marlin Equity Partners (“Marlin”). The investment positions TIS to execute on organic and inorganic strategic initiatives to further serve the Office of the CFO. The agreement is subject to customary regulatory clearance. A closing of the transaction is expected in the second quarter.
tag_to_content.p_1: TIS’ Group CEO Erik Masing commented “this exciting partnership with Marlin will fuel our international expansion efforts, leveraging their expertise to broaden our partnerships and strengthen our product offering. In an era of supply chain disruption, rate volatility and macroeconomic uncertainty, the importance of liquidity management, working capital optimization, and secure, efficient B2B payments has never been higher for our customers. The Marlin team demonstrated a deep appreciation for the strength of our value proposition and a strong alignment with our strategic goals.”
tag_to_content.p_2: Chris Calhoun, TIS’ CEO of Americas, added “Marlin’s deep understanding of the European and U.S. markets, as well as their experience in the Office of the CFO and monetization of data and payments in particular were the key reasons we were keen to partner with them.”
tag_to_content.p_3: “The TIS team impressed us with their strategic and innovative product offering, strong banking integrations and dedicated customers focus. The company’s mission-critical platform is well positioned to deliver continued growth in the global market for B2B payments, cashflow and treasury management solutions,” said Konstantin von Bismarck from Marlin.
tag_to_content.p_4: “We are excited to welcome TIS to our family of software businesses and are thrilled to support the company’s vision of helping more enterprises effectively, securely and transparently manage their treasury needs.”
tag_to_content.p_5: The deal marks TIS’ exit from the HEGCF I portfolio, managed by Claret Capital Partners.
tag_to_content.p_6: David Bateman, Managing Partner at Claret Capital Partners comments: “We are delighted to have supported TIS on their growth journey to date, and wish the team every success in their partnership with Marlin as they continue to expand internationally.”

tag_to_content.title: Portfolio - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_0: We like to work with entrepreneurs who are using innovation to disrupt the industries they work in. We provide scale up and acquisition capital to help them grow revenues and enterprise value.
tag_to_content.p_2: Selected Claret Capital Partners Portfolio Companies:
tag_to_content.p_3: We raise funds to provide growth capital in sectors across Europe as diverse as:

tag_to_content.title: Team - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_0: Our team has experience spanning more than 20 years and 200 deals investing across Europe. From the dotcom bubble, through the credit crunch and now the global pandemic the team has continued to back management teams and to support stake holders in building the next phase of their companies.
tag_to_content.p_2: David is Managing Partner of Claret Capital Partners. David has more than 20 years of experience in technology lending and financing. Prior to the buyout of Claret Capital from Harbert Management Corporation, he and Johan Kampe had co-founded Harbert European Growth Capital. From 2002-2011 David was with ETV Capital, one of the leading providers of European growth loans at the time, where he was responsible for originating and managing investments and served on the Board. Prior to ETV, David worked at Broadview International, where he spent 7 years originating and executing technology M&A and financing transactions. David earned a BA at Trinity College Dublin, a Diplomkaufmann from EAP-ESCP and a Masters in Finance at the London Business School. David is a citizen and resident of Ireland.
tag_to_content.p_4: Johan is Managing Partner of Claret Capital Partners. Johan has more than 22 years of experience in technology lending and financing. Prior to joining HMC in January 2013, he and David co-founded Benefide, a firm focused on originating specialty debt transactions on a deal-by-deal basis, closing eight transactions over an 18 month period. From 2005-2011 Johan was with ETV Capital, one of the leading providers of European growth loans at the time, where he was responsible for originating investments and was an alternate on the company’s investment committee. Prior to joining ETV, Johan was with Silicon Valley Bank, and co-founded the European subsidiary of the bank, SVB Europe Advisors, funding technology and growth businesses and backing venture capital funds. Prior to that, Johan worked with a startup company and various financial institutions, including Prudential and American Express. Johan earned BA in Finance and International Business from San Jose State University (Magna Cum Laude). Johan is a Swedish citizen.
tag_to_content.p_6: Paul is the Operating Partner of CCP. Paul has over 30 years of experience in financial markets, having spent the last 15 years as a CFO and COO in the alternative investment sector. Prior to joining CCP, Paul ran his own consultancy business for 4 years, providing financial, operational, risk and regulatory support to private equity and hedge fund managers looking to grow their asset base, launch new funds or enhance their infrastructure. Prior to this Paul was interim COO at Pillarstone Europe and COO of Eclectica Asset Management where he helped to double assets under management in two years to $1.3bn, through new fund launches and the setting of higher operational due diligence standards. From 2010 to 2012 Paul was COO (Asset Management) for Matrix Group, overseeing the operations and development of a £4bn diverse asset base. In this role he served as board director of several regulated entities. He started his career as an auditor with Arthur Andersen where he qualified as a chartered accountant before becoming European Treasurer for a mid-sized US fixed income house and subsequently, Head of European Cash Management for Merrill Lynch International. Paul has an MA from the University of Oxford and is a qualified corporate treasurer.
tag_to_content.p_8: Lyall joined the Claret Capital Partners (CCP) in March 2015. He assists the team across all aspects of the investment process and research related to the marketing of the fund. Prior to joining CCP, Lyall was the Director of Marketing at a start up in the United States, providing SME’s with marketing and analytics tools. He holds a Bachelor’s Degree from the University of California, Berkeley where he studied International Business and Development.
tag_to_content.p_10: Antony joined the Claret Capital Partners in June 2017. He has responsibility across the full deal cycle and all aspects of the investment process, with a focus on sourcing, evaluating and executing investments in high growth companies across the Technology and Life Sciences sectors. Prior to joining CCP Antony worked at PwC in its Valuations business, having previously been part of its Insurance & Investment Management practice. He is a Chartered Accountant (ICAEW) and holds a Bachelor’s Degree from the University of Manchester, where he studied Geography.
tag_to_content.p_12: Brian joined Claret Capital Partners in January 2023. He has more than 15 years of experience in lending to high growth companies. At Claret, he supports the team across all aspects of the investment process for innovative companies across Europe. Prior to joining CCP, Brian spent eight years at Silicon Valley Bank, where he led their Irish business and supported Technology and Life Science companies with more than $500m in debt financing. Prior to joining Silicon Valley Bank, Brian spent four years at Barclays, and three years at Bank of Scotland (Ireland). Brian holds a Bachelor of Business Studies in Accounting and Finance from Technological University Dublin.
tag_to_content.p_14: Nick is a Portfolio Director at Claret. He joined the team in 2021. Prior to Claret, Nick worked in finance at a number of Series A start-ups as well as in banking.  He is a qualified accountant (ICAS) and serves as an advisor to a number of early stage businesses.
tag_to_content.p_16: Daniel is a Principal at Claret Capital Partners. Prior to joining Claret in May 2019, Daniel was in the Corporate Finance department of Grant Thornton between 2018 to 2019. Daniel initially started his professional career in PwC Dublin where he received the ACA qualification with all first time passes. Daniel earned a Bachelor of Business Studies degree from Trinity College Dublin in 2013 and a Diploma in Corporate Finance from the ICAEW and CISI in 2018.
tag_to_content.p_18: Philip joined the team in June 2022 with a focus on sourcing new investment opportunities and performing fundamental research and company analysis. Mr Treacy has been in the industry since 2015. Prior to joining Claret Capital Partners, Mr. Treacy worked as an Investment Analyst for Beach Point Capital Management focused on their venture debt strategy and before then Mr. Treacy worked as an M&A analyst at Uniphar Plc focused on their buy and build strategy. Mr. Treacy received a BSc in Economics and Finance from University College Dublin and an MSc in Quantitative Finance from UCD Michael Smurfit Graduate Business School.
tag_to_content.p_20: Charlotte joined the team in September 2022 as a Graduate Investment Analyst to support with deal origination, execution, and portfolio management. Prior to joining the team at Claret, Charlotte spent 18 months working as an Analyst at the Scottish National Investment Bank where she worked across the Investment Origination and Impact Management teams. Charlotte holds a First-Class honours degree in Accounting and Finance from the University of Aberdeen and has passed her CFA Level 1 exam.
tag_to_content.p_22: Jared joined Claret Capital Partners in October 2021. As a Portfolio Associate in the team, Jared focuses on providing thorough insights to enhance investment performance. Prior to this role, Jared gained valuable experience as a Financial Analyst at an early-stage startup in London. In 2023, Jared earned his CFA Charter. Additionally, he holds a degree in Investment Management from the University of Pretoria, South Africa.
tag_to_content.p_24: George joined Claret in November 2022 and is responsible for supporting deal origination and fundamental company analysis.
tag_to_content.p_25: Prior to joining Claret, George worked at Arden Partners as a Corporate Finance Manager, executing on a number of IPO’s, Fundraises and M&A transactions. George qualified as a Chartered Accountant (ACA) at PwC, working in the Private Business – Audit and Assurance department. George holds a BEng in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Nottingham.
tag_to_content.p_27: Max joined the team in August 2022. As an Investment Analyst, he is responsible for supporting deal origination and execution for growth-stage businesses across Europe. Max holds a first-class honours degree from the University of Leeds, where he studied Mathematics and Finance and participated in both the Leeds Investment and Trading Society and the Rugby Union Society. Max also passed his CFA Level 1 exam.
tag_to_content.p_29: Ryan joined Claret Capital Partners in November 2021 as Fund Controller and oversees the financial, operational and reporting aspects of the Firm’s Funds. Ryan started his career in Audit with Buzzacott where he qualified as an accountant (ACA), subsequently he moved to into Fund Administration with Langham Hall where he progressed to Senior Manager overseeing a number of private fund clients including venture capital and debt strategies. Ryan holds a Masters in Finance and Investment from the University of Exeter.
tag_to_content.p_31: Kieran, holding BSc in Finance from Queen’s University Belfast, joined Claret Capital Partners as Fund Accountant in March 2022. Kieran has previously worked for Deutsche Bank and BNP Paribas in Private Equity and Hedge Fund Accounting teams. Most recently he worked for SEI Investments as a Private Equity Fund Accounting Supervisor. He will continue to pursue his ACCA (part qualified) studies.
tag_to_content.p_33: Richard joined Claret Capital Partners in October 2023 and is responsible for finance and the compliance reporting of the company. Richard has more than 7 years’ experience leading finance teams in regulated environments. Richard is a Chartered Accountant CA (SA), having qualified at Deloitte South Africa before spending a further two years at Deloitte Guernsey working as an Audit Manager. Prior to joining Claret, Richard headed up the finance function for a Guernsey based investment manager and stockbroker, a London based tech company and an LME commodities broker.
tag_to_content.p_34: HR & OFFICE MANAGER (MATERNITY COVER FOR REBECCA BROOKE)
tag_to_content.span_10: HR & OFFICE MANAGER (MATERNITY COVER FOR REBECCA BROOKE)
tag_to_content.p_35: Natalie joined the Claret team in November as interim HR & Office Manager (Maternity cover for Rebecca Brook). Her role will support the CFO and wider team with day-to-day operations in the London office.
tag_to_content.p_36: As part of her role, Natalie will also support the wider People & Culture agenda looking after personal development, wellbeing and the growth of the team.
tag_to_content.p_37: Natalie has over 12 years’ experience working across hospitality, operations and workplace experience. Most recently at Boston Consulting Group, where she worked as part of the Senior Business Operations.
tag_to_content.p_39: Francesca joined Claret in June 2023 as Executive Assistant to David Bateman & the Principals. Her role is primarily supporting the Managing Partner in all day-to-day activities and workflow, as well as the wider team.
tag_to_content.p_40: Francesca has seven years experience working across various sectors in administrative and support roles, most recently at the global executive search firm, Odgers Berndtson. Earlier in her career she also spent two and half years working in Dubai.
tag_to_content.p_42: Agustin joined Claret in February 2023 as Office Manager and EA to Johan Kampe. Based in Malaga, Spain, Agustin supports the Managing Partner in all day-to-day activities and workflow.
tag_to_content.p_43: He has previously worked in the Argentinean banking industry as budget controller and as Management Operational Analyst.
tag_to_content.p_44: Agustin has also worked as General Coordinator of international and national congresses, events and as office manager at the Latin American Society of Transplantation.
tag_to_content.p_45: Agustin holds a Business Administration degree of the University of Buenos Aires (UBA), Argentina with over a decade of intensive experience in the field.
tag_to_content.p_47: Rebecca joined Claret in March 2023 as HR & Office Manager, supporting the CFO and wider team in day-to-day operations.
tag_to_content.p_48: Her role encompasses ensuring staff wellbeing, productivity, personal development and growth. Rebecca works with the Support team to ensure a welcoming office environment and a busy and exciting atmosphere while helping to ensure smooth processes and effective outputs for the team.
tag_to_content.p_49: Rebecca has 7 years experience working within administrative support functions, most recently heading up Operations and HR at a leading design practice in central London.
tag_to_content.p_50: Rebecca graduated from Westminster University in 2015 with BA Hons in Illustration.

tag_to_content.title: Claret European Growth Capital Fund III backs Territory Studio to fuel growth - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_0: We’re delighted to announce that the Claret European Growth Capital Fund III (“the Fund”), managed by Claret Capital Partners Limited (“Claret”), has backed Territory Studio (“Territory”).
tag_to_content.p_1: Part of Territory Group, Territory Studio is a Visual Effects and Motion Graphics specialist that draws on expertise in narrative-led creative design to imagine, realise and build new worlds. The studio boasts best-in-class creative talent who practice their craft with a unique combination of refined design intelligence and near future expertise.
tag_to_content.p_2: Territory’s impressive project portfolio includes collaborations with multiple major blockbuster titles including Mission Impossible: Dead Reckoning, The Batman, Blade Runner 2049, Avengers: Endgame, and The Martian. Furthermore, Territory works with several Fortune 500 clients to create outstanding product, brand and campaign creative work.
tag_to_content.p_3: The investment from Claret will support Territory in accelerating growth, expanding capabilities, and solidifying its position as a world-leading, bleeding-edge creative studio.
tag_to_content.p_4: Lyall Davenport, Principal at Claret Capital Partners, commented: “Territory has an exceptional track record. Their dedication to pushing the boundaries between design and technology aligns perfectly with Claret’s philosophy of supporting innovative and visionary companies, and we are excited to support the business as they continue to grow.”
tag_to_content.p_5: Nick Glover, Founder & CEO of Territory Studio said: “Securing the backing of Claret marks an exciting milestone for Territory. We very much look forward to having them support us on our next chapter of growth and development.”
tag_to_content.p_7: Territory Studio is a creative specialist that draws on expertise in narrative-led creative design to imagine, realise and build new worlds. What ties our work together is a love of craft and creativity, a passion for story, and a designer’s eye for problem-solving. What sets us apart is a uniquely refined design intelligence, near future expertise, and a team of ambitious, focused, and proactive cross discipline creatives. We use the power of imagination to realise New Worlds.

tag_to_content.title: PRIVACY STATEMENT - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_0: Claret Capital Partners Website Privacy Policy
tag_to_content.p_2: Claret Capital Partners Limited with offices in London collectively known as “Claret”.
tag_to_content.p_3: What is the purpose of this privacy notice?
tag_to_content.p_4: This privacy notice details what personal information we may collect, process and store about our Clients in order to adhere to EU Data Protection Directive 95/46/EC (“GDPR”) and other local regulatory authorities. “Personal Information” means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’).
tag_to_content.p_5: How do we process your personal Data?
tag_to_content.p_6: Claret will receive, store, and/or process personal data. In such cases, we are acting as a data processor and will process the personal information on behalf of and under the direction of our partners and/or clients. The information that we collect from our clients in this capacity is used for managing transactions, reporting, invoicing, renewals, other operations related to providing services to the client.
tag_to_content.p_7: Claret uses personal data that it collects directly from its clients in its role as a service provider for the following business purposes, without limitation:
tag_to_content.li_10: Maintaining and supporting its products/services, delivering and providing the requested products/services, and complying with its contractual obligations related thereto (including operations related to providing services to a client);
tag_to_content.li_11: Satisfying governmental reporting, tax, and other requirements;
tag_to_content.li_12: Storing and processing data, including personal data, in computer databases and servers located in the United States, EMEA and Asia;
tag_to_content.li_13: Verifying identity (e.g., for access to accounts or for service desk support);
tag_to_content.li_15: For other business-related purposes permitted or required under applicable local law and regulation;
tag_to_content.li_16: and as otherwise required by law.
tag_to_content.p_8: Claret does not disclose personal information to third parties for purposes that are materially different than what it was originally collected for. Should this change in the future, we will provide individuals with the option to opt-out.
tag_to_content.p_9: What Data do we Collect?Claret has identified the following Data Fields as potentially collected on the basis of providing Contractual Services to its clients and their members of staff:
tag_to_content.p_11: Claret has also identified the following Data Fields as potentially collected on the basis of provided consent to send further information to website visitors:
tag_to_content.p_12: What do we do with it?
tag_to_content.p_13: Claret complies with its obligations under GDPR by keeping personal data up to date; by storing and destroying it securely; by not collecting or retaining excessive amounts of data; by protecting personal data from loss, misuse, unauthorised access and disclosure and by ensuring that appropriate technical measures are in place to protect personal data.
tag_to_content.p_14: How long will we keep it?
tag_to_content.p_15: Claret only retain the personal data in accordance with contractual or regulation requirements. If you have provided consent to your information being used for marketing purposes it will be kept with us until you notify us that you no longer wish to receive this information.
tag_to_content.p_16: Your Rights in connection with Personal Data
tag_to_content.p_17: Under certain circumstances, individuals have the right to:
tag_to_content.li_39: Request a copy of their personal data (commonly known as a “data subject access request”). this enables them to receive a copy of the personal information we hold about them and to check that we are lawfully processing it.
tag_to_content.li_40: Request correction of the personal data that we hold about them.
tag_to_content.li_41: Request the erasure of personal data. an individual may ask us to delete or remove personal data where there is no good reason for us continuing to process it. an individual may also request that we stop processing personal data where we are relying on a legitimate interest and there is something about their particular situation which permits an object to processing on this ground.
tag_to_content.li_42: Request the restriction of processing of personal data for example until its accuracy or the reason for processing it is more clearly established.
tag_to_content.li_43: Request the transfer of personal data to another party.
tag_to_content.p_18: Individuals who wish to review, verify, correct or request erasure of Personal Data, object to the processing of Personal Data, or request that we transfer a copy of Personal Data to another party, please contact our nominated representative using the information at the end of this notice.
tag_to_content.p_20: Changes may be necessary to this policy to reflect legal or data processing developments. The revised Privacy Policy will be posted on this website. A notice will be posted on our homepage for 30 days whenever this Privacy Policy is changed in a material way, and the date of last update will be indicated at the top of the Privacy Policy.

tag_to_content.title: Claret Capital raises €297 million fund for European tech start-ups - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.h1_0: Claret Capital raises €297 million fund for European tech start-ups

a_11.text: Claret Capital raises €297 million fund for European tech start-ups

tag_to_content.li_10: Claret’s ‘Fund III’ will back innovative businesses in the technology and life sciences sector
tag_to_content.li_11: Over €500M of capital in the next three years will be deployed to support an additional 50-60 companies
tag_to_content.p_0: 31 August 2022, London, United Kingdom – Claret Capital (Claret Capital Partners Limited), the London-based Pan-European growth capital provider, announces the final closing of Claret European Growth Capital Fund III (‘Fund III’). With total commitments of €297 million, the firm has closed well over its original target of €250 million, extending Claret’s position as one of the leaders within the European growth lending sector.
tag_to_content.p_1: The final close of Fund III includes commitments from a broad range of leading institutional investors who continue to support Claret within the debt financing market. Repeat investors include EIF, British Business Investments, RAG-Stiftung, Certior Capital and KfW Capital.
tag_to_content.p_2: In addition to the final close of Fund III, a number of co-investment agreements have been finalised which provide substantial additional firepower to offer loan facilities of up to €50M.
tag_to_content.p_3: Since the first investment from Fund III in March 2021, Claret has welcomed 29 businesses into the Fund III portfolio. Fund III will continue to invest in innovative growth stage technology and life science businesses throughout Europe – primarily to support organic growth and M&A. Taken together, the final close of Fund III and the co-invest vehicles enable Claret to support businesses with over €500M of capital in the next three years with which we expect to support an additional 50-60 new companies.
tag_to_content.p_4: Claret was formed through the MBO of Harbert European Growth Capital (“Harbert”) in 2020. Over the past nine years, the team behind Claret has become one of the preeminent providers of growth debt to SMEs in Europe, backing over 150 companies and investing more than half a billion euros. Recent exits include numerous acquisitions such as: Packlink (acquired by Auctane), Aava (acquired by Pepperl & Fuchs), Bright Computing (acquired by NVIDIA), Miss Group (bought out by Perwyn & management), SuperAwesome (acquired by EPIC Group), Synthesio (acquired by IPSOS), AdaptiveMobile (acquired by Enea), Longboat Clinical (acquired by Advarra), and Decibel (acquired by Medallia), as well as publicly held businesses Eurobio Scientific (EPA: ALERS), SFC Energy (F3C.DE).
tag_to_content.p_5: The Fund III commitments have come from a wide group of premier institutional investors and include five new institutional investors; Allied Irish Banks, Aozora Bank, Banca March, HNA, and the Ireland Strategic Investment Fund (ISIF), as well as entrepreneurs and industry experts. Claret will continue its mission of providing low dilution growth capital to innovative European companies.
tag_to_content.p_6: Johan Kampe, Managing Partner of Claret commented:
tag_to_content.p_7: “We are proud to have closed our third Fund over target and will continue to support existing portfolio companies in the Fund & future European growth businesses. From enterprise software, to fintech startups to marketplaces – we look forward to partnering with leadership teams disrupting the industries they work in. In a market where uncertainty is impacting venture capital funding, the outlook remains positive in growth financing and we’re excited to grow our portfolio business and founders.”
tag_to_content.p_8: David Bateman, Managing Partner of Claret, added:
tag_to_content.p_9: “We have been delighted by the response to our third fund. Closing above target underlines the tremendous opportunity that we have within the wider European tech & life sciences sector. We are seeing a strong demand for our capital from Europe’s best entrepreneurs and equity investors. We look forward to supporting the companies in the Fund and our new investments as they work to deliver their ground-breaking innovations to market.”
tag_to_content.p_10: Claret Capital funds high growth business with proven management teams in need of less dilutive capital to drive their continued ambitions. Loans vary in size but are typically between €1 million to €50 million, with each business evaluated on an independent basis by our team of experienced investment professionals.
tag_to_content.p_11: For all press inquiries, please contact: Caroline Moylan at cm@claret-capital.com

tag_to_content.title: Public Disclosures - Claret Capital Partners
tag_to_content.p_0: Public disclosures by Claret Capital Partners Limited
tag_to_content.p_1: Public Disclosures pertaining to Specially Permitted Business for Qualified Institutional Investors, etc.
tag_to_content.p_2: Pursuant to the Financial Instruments and Exchange Act in Japan, Business Operators of Specially Permitted Businesses for Qualified Institutional Investors, etc. are required to make available to the public certain information. If you would like to obtain such information as to Claret European Growth Capital Fund III GP, S.à r.l., please make a request via email to finance@claret-capital.com and indicate your name, company name, position and email address, and such information will be sent to you via email promptly after your request.
